（ここで少し休憩しよう。[lr]
text.en-US: Let's take a short break here. [lr]

text.key: （噴水の淵に腰かけ、シルヴィも隣に座るように手招きする。[p]
text.en-US: (Sylvie sits on the edge of the fountain, and beckons me to sit next to her.[p]

text.key: （だんだん日も傾き始めてきた。[p_]
text.en-US: Gradually, the daylight begins to wane.[p_]

text.key: （生活に必要なものを買って今日はもう帰ろう…。[p_]
text.en-US: (I'll just buy some necessities and go home for today...[p_]

text.key: …おはようございます、[name][p_]
text.en-US: ...Good morning, [name].[p_]

text.key: その、昨日はごめんなさい。[lr_]
text.en-US: Um, I apologize for yesterday. [lr_]

text.key: お酒のせいだと思うんですけどなんだか気が緩んでしまったみたいで…。[p_]
text.en-US: I think it was the alcohol, but my attitude seemed to slip quite a bit...[p_]

text.key: 昨日は…その…、気持ちよすぎて…[p_]
text.en-US: Last night... Um... It felt too good, and...[p_]

text.key: いつの間にか意識が飛んじゃってたみたいです。[p_]
text.en-US: It seems like I passed out without knowing it.[p_]

text.key: 気がついたら、もう朝で…。[lr_]
text.en-US: When I woke up it was already morning... [lr_]

text.key: すいません。[p_]
text.en-US: I'm sorry.[p_]

text.key: 昨日は、その…勝手なことをして、ごめんなさい。[lr_]
text.en-US: Yesterday, um... I'm sorry for doing something so selfish. [lr_]

text.key: 自分で自分が抑えられなくて…。[p_]
text.en-US: I couldn't hold myself back anymore...[p_]

text.key: でも、昨日の[name]凄かった…♡[p_]
text.en-US: But you were amazing last night, [name]...♡[p_]

text.key: 正確には覚えてないんですけど…[r]
text.en-US: I don't remember exactly, but... [r]

text.key: たくさん…していただいたんですよね。[p_]
text.en-US: We... did it a lot, right?[p_]

text.key: …まだ脚に力が入らないんです。[lr_]
text.en-US: ...My legs still feel weak. [lr_]

text.key: 今日は家で休ませていただいていいでしょうか？[p_]
text.en-US: Is it okay for me to rest today?[p_]

text.key: …もう、落ち着きました。[lr_]
text.en-US: ...I've calmed down. [lr_]

text.key: 改めておはようございます。[p_]
text.en-US: Again, good morning.[p_]

text.key: もうお昼近いですね。[lr_]
text.en-US: It's almost after noon, huh? [lr_]

text.key: [name]が朝からあんなにするから…。[p_]
text.en-US: It's all because [name] was so feisty so early in the morning...[p_]

text.key: …嫌ではないですけど。[p_]
text.en-US: ...I didn't dislike it though.[p_]

text.key: …大丈夫です、落ち着きました。[lr_]
text.en-US: ...I'm fine, I've calmed down.[p_]

text.key: もう午後ですね。[p_]
text.en-US: It's already the afternoon.[p_]

text.key: [name]があんなにするから、私もう今日はまともに動けそうもないです…。[p_]
text.en-US: And all because of [name], I can't seem to move my legs...[p_]

text.key: 昨日は家まで運んでくれて、ありがとうございました。[p_]
text.en-US: Thank you for carrying me home yesterday.[p_]

text.key: しかも私、帰りに疲れて寝ちゃったみたいで…。[lr_]
text.en-US: But it seems like I was tired and fell asleep on the way back... [lr_]

text.key: すいません…。[p_]
text.en-US: I'm sorry...[p_]

text.key: 昨日は診療所のシーツ、１枚汚してしまいましたね…。[lr_]
text.en-US: Yesterday we dirtied one of the clinic's sheets, didn't we... [lr_]

text.key: なるべく早いうちに洗っておきます…。[p_]
text.en-US: I'll make sure to clean it sooner than later for you...[p_]

text.key: その、昨日のことは忘れていただけませんか？[lr_]
text.en-US: Could you please forget about what happened yesterday? [lr_]

text.key: お酒のせいとはいえあんな…。[p_]
text.en-US: I was acting like that due to alcohol...[p_]

text.key: 結局、朝までしてしまいましたね…。[p_]
text.en-US: In the end, we did it until morning...[p_]

text.key: もうお昼…。何か食べましょうか。[p_]
text.en-US: It's already noon... We should have something to eat.[p_]

text.key: ん…ごめんなさい。しばらく立てそうもありません。[lr_]
text.en-US: Mn... I'm sorry. It doesn't seem like I can stand yet. [lr_]

text.key: というか、まだ、体の震えも治まってなくて…。[p_]
text.en-US: Rather, my body is still trembling...[p_]

text.key: …[p]（もう夜だ…寝支度をしよう[p]
text.en-US: ...[p](It's night already... Let's prepare for bed.[p]

text.key: …[p_]（もう夜だ…寝支度をしよう[p_]
text.en-US: ...[p_](It's already evening... I should get ready for bed.[p_]

text.key: あ、なんでもないです。[lr_]
text.en-US: Ah, it's nothing. [lr_]

text.key: そろそろ寝ましょうか。[p_]
text.en-US: We should get to sleep soon.[p_]

text.key: …じゃあそろそろ寝ましょうか。[p_]
text.en-US: ...Well then, let's get some sleep.[p_]

text.key: ふぁ…。[lr_]
text.en-US: Fwah... [lr_]

text.key: ん、お酒のせいか、眠くなってきました。[p_]
text.en-US: Mm, I wonder if it's because of the alcohol, I'm feeling sleepy.[p_]

text.key: 今日はカフェのデザート、美味しかったです。[lr_]
text.en-US: The dessert at the cafe today was delicious. [lr_]

text.key: 良ければまた、一緒に行きたいです。[p_]
text.en-US: If it's all right, I'd like to go there again with you.[p_]

text.key: さっきのお店のご飯は美味しかったですね。[lr_]
text.en-US: The meal we just had at the restaurant sure was delicious, wasn't it? [lr_]

text.key: お腹いっぱいでぐっすり眠れそうです。[p_]
text.en-US: My stomach is so full I'm sure I'll sleep soundly tonight.[p_]

text.key: 今日はまた私の服を買ってもらって、ありがとうございました。[lr_]
text.en-US: Thank you for buying me more clothes today. [lr_]

text.key: 明日はこれを着て[name]とお出かけできたらな…なんて。[p_]
text.en-US: It'd be nice to go out with you wearing them tomorrow, [name]... Hehe.[p_]

text.key: 今日はまた私の装飾を買ってもらって、ありがとうございました。[lr_]
text.en-US: Thank you for buying more accessories for me today. [lr_]

text.key: 明日はこれを付けて[name]とお出かけできたらな…なんて。[p_]
text.en-US: It'd be fun to go out with you wearing them tomorrow, [name]... Hehe.[p_]

text.key: 今日はお仕事お疲れ様でした。[lr_]
text.en-US: We did our best with work today. [lr_]

text.key: 今日は午後にお茶をして…少しゆったりした日でしたね。[lr_]
text.en-US: Today we had tea in the afternoon... It was a relaxed day, wasn't it? [lr_]

text.key: [name]が買ってきてくださった[miyage]も美味しかったです。[p_]
text.en-US: The [miyage] that [name] brought home ended up being delicious too![p_]

text.key: 今日は午後にお茶をして…少しゆったりした日でしたね。[p_]
text.en-US: Today we had tea in the afternoon... It was a relaxed day, wasn't it?[p_]

text.key: 今日はなんだかずっと[name]に撫でてもらってた気がします。[lr_]
text.en-US: I feel like all that happened today was that [name] patted my head. [lr_]

text.key: 私こんなに幸せでいいんでしょうか…。[p_]
text.en-US: I wonder if it's really okay for me to be this happy...[p_]

text.key: 今日は[name]とお出かけできて楽しかったです。[lr_]
text.en-US: It was a lot of fun to go out with you today, [name]. [lr_]

text.key: 緑の中お散歩するとなんだか気分も晴れやかになる気がしますね。[p_]
text.en-US: I feel like just by walking among the trees, your mood can really improve.[p_]

text.key: あの市場は行くたび少しお店が違っていて何度行っても新鮮ですね。[p_]
text.en-US: Each time we wander the market there always seems to be a new stall, so it never gets dull.[p_]

text.key: あの広場はゆったりできていいですね。[p_]
text.en-US: It sure is nice to have a town square where you can just sit and relax.[p_]

text.key: 今日はその…[lr_]
text.en-US: Today we, um... [lr_]

text.key: 午後しか動けなかったからか少し短く感じましたね。[p_]
text.en-US: I couldn't do much until the afternoon so the day felt pretty short.[p_]

text.key: 今日は何をしたわけではないですけど、[r]
text.en-US: We didn't really do anything much today, [r]

text.key: たくさん[name]とお話できて楽しかったです。[p_]
text.en-US: but spending time just talking with [name] was fun.[p_]

text.key: 今日も一緒に…。[p_]
text.en-US: Tonight, together...[p_]

text.key: おやすみなさいませ…。[p_]
text.en-US: Good night to you...[p_]

text.key: [xy tg1='*talk_a_loop'  tg2='*talk_room_a' ]
[name]？[lr_]
text.en-US: [name]? [lr_]

text.key: …大好きです。[p_]
text.en-US: ...I love you.[p_]

text.key: ずっと、一緒ですよね…。[p_]
text.en-US: We'll always be together, right...?[p_]

text.key: お出かけも楽しいけど、こうして家で二人きりも落ち着きますね。[p_]
text.en-US: Going out is fun, but staying home together is also relaxing.[p_]

text.key: 私、幸せです。[lr_]
text.en-US: I'm very happy. [lr_]

text.key: [name]といれば昔のこと、思い出してもつらくならなくなりました。[p_]
text.en-US: If I'm with [name], even remembering the past isn't painful.[p_]

text.key: …[name]。[p_]
（何をしなくとも微笑みを向けてくる[p_]
text.en-US: (Even though I haven't done anything she smiles at me.[p_]

text.key: （何もいわずに身を寄せてきた。[p_]
text.en-US: (She comes closer without saying anything.[p_]

text.key: [name]といると昔のことを忘れていられます。[p_]
text.en-US: When I'm together with [name] I can forget about my past.[p_]

text.key: [name]がそばにいないと、少し不安になってしまいます。[lr_]
text.en-US: If [name] isn't nearby I get slightly anxious. [lr_]

text.key: できるだけ一緒にいてもいいですか？[p_]
text.en-US: Can I be with you as long as I can?[p_]

text.key: 一人の夜はもう嫌です…。[lr_]
text.en-US: I don't like sleeping by myself anymore... [lr_]

text.key: 一緒にいてください。[p_]
text.en-US: Please be with me.[p_]

text.key: [name]といれば、どこにいても何をしていても楽しいです。[p_]
text.en-US: If I'm together with [name], anything and everything becomes fun.[p_]

text.key: [name]のくれるものは全部私の宝物です。[lr_]
text.en-US: Everything [name] gives me is my treasure. [lr_]

text.key: 物も、気持ちも、思い出も[p_]
text.en-US: Objects, feelings, and memories...[p_]

text.key: もっと[name]に好きになってもらいたいです。[lr_]
text.en-US: I want to be liked by [name] even more. [lr_]

text.key: 私、がんばります。[p_]
text.en-US: I'll try my very best.[p_]

text.key: 私の傷、醜くないですか？[lr_]
text.en-US: Aren't my scars ugly? [lr_]

text.key: [name]が嫌なら、できるだけ隠したいんですけど…[p_]
text.en-US: If [name] doesn't like it, I want to hide as much of them as possible...[p_]

text.key: どこにも行かないでくださいね…。[p_]
text.en-US: Please don't go anywhere...[p_]

text.key: 何か、してほしいことはないですか？[lr_]
text.en-US: Is there anything you'd like me to do? [lr_]

text.key: [name]のお役に立ちたいです。[p_]
text.en-US: I want to be of use to you, [name].[p_]

text.key: のどは渇いてませんか？[lr_]
text.en-US: Are you thirsty? [lr_]

text.key: なにかお飲み物、もってきましょうか？[p_]
text.en-US: Shall I bring you a drink?[p_]

text.key: お腹空きませんか？[lr_]
text.en-US: Are you hungry? [lr_]

text.key: 簡単なものでよければ何か作りますよ。[p_]
text.en-US: I can make you something simple to eat if you want.[p_]

text.key: お掃除と洗濯と、お料理もきっと上手になって…。[lr_]
text.en-US: I'll become good at cleaning, laundry, and cooking... [lr_]

text.key: あとは、何ができるかな…。[p_]
text.en-US: What else can I do...?[p_]

text.key: ご迷惑じゃなければ、[name]のお仕事も手伝わせてくれませんか？[p_]
text.en-US: If it's not a bother, could I also help you with your work, [name]?[p_]

text.key: あの服屋の店員さん、ちょっと怖くないですか？[lr_]
text.en-US: Isn't the shopkeeper at that clothing store a little scary? [lr_]

text.key: 今度あの商人の方に会ったら、きちんとお礼をしたいですね。[p_]
text.en-US: If I meet that merchant again, I want to thank him properly.[p_]

text.key: [name]のように優しくはなかったけど、ひどいこともしなかったし、[lr_]
text.en-US: He wasn't nice like [name], but he didn't do anything mean to me, [lr_]

text.key: 何より私をここに連れてきてくれたのはいくら感謝してもしきれません。[p_]
text.en-US: and I can't thank him enough for bringing me here.[p_]

text.key: …ぁ、ごめんなさい。[lr_]
text.en-US: ...Ah, I'm sorry. [lr_]

text.key: 少しウトウトしちゃったみたいです[p_]
text.en-US: It seems like I was dozing off.[p_]

text.key: お出かけは楽しいですけど、[name]以外の人はまだ少し怖いんです…。[p_]
text.en-US: Going out is fun, but I'm still a bit afraid of people other than you, [name]...[p_]

text.key: [name]に引き取ってもらえて、私本当に幸運でした。[lr_]
text.en-US: I was extremely lucky to be taken in by you, [name]. [lr_]

text.key: 今までの不幸がかすむぐらい…。[p_]
text.en-US: As if all the sadness until now was a lie...[p_]

text.key: 本棚の本を見てみてもいいですか？[lr_]
text.en-US: Can I look at the books on the bookshelf? [lr_]

text.key: 一応読み書きはできるんです。[p_]
text.en-US: I can read and write to an extent.[p_]

text.key: 知識がある方が[name]のお役に立てることも増えるかもしれないし。[p_]
text.en-US: I might be of more use to [name] if I become more learned.[p_]

text.key: [name]は自分のお洋服を買ったりはしないんですか？[p_]
text.en-US: Do you not buy any clothes of your own, [name]?[p_]

text.key: 私のお洋服ばかり買っていただいて…。[p_]
text.en-US: You're always buying clothes for me...[p_]

text.key: お洋服を買ってもらえるのも、[r]
text.en-US: I'm really happy to have you buy clothes for me, [r]

text.key: 美味しいデザートをご馳走してもらえるのも嬉しいです。[p_]
text.en-US: and letting me eat delicious desserts.[p_]

text.key: でも気を使わなくても大丈夫ですよ？[lr_]
text.en-US: But it's fine to not go out of your way for me. [lr_]

text.key: 私、[name]がいればそれだけで幸せですから。[p_]
text.en-US: Being together with [name] is more than enough for me.[p_]

text.key: 患者さんの病気や怪我もそれほどひどくないみたいですし、[r]
text.en-US: The illnesses and injuries of the patients don't seem to be too major. [r]

text.key: この街は平和な所なんですね。[p_]
text.en-US: This town sure is peaceful, isn't it?[p_]

text.key: 私が育った場所はもっと治安の悪いところにありました。[p_]
text.en-US: The place where I grew up was a lot less peaceful.[p_]

text.key: ここに来る前のお屋敷には私の他にも奴隷が何人かいました。[p_]
text.en-US: The mansion I lived in before I came here had many other slaves besides me.[p_]

text.key: 雑用や労働のための奴隷。[lr_]
text.en-US: Slaves for chores and labor... [lr_]

text.key: 夜の相手をする奴隷。[lr_]
text.en-US: Slaves to keep him company at night... [lr_]

text.key: 私はただ、痛めつけて楽しむための奴隷だったみたいです。[p_]
text.en-US: It seems like I was there just so he could enjoy watching me suffer.[p_]

text.key: 前に私を飼っていた人。[lr_]
text.en-US: The person who owned me before... [lr_]

text.key: 事故で亡くなったって言われてましたけど、本当は違うんです。[p_]
text.en-US: They say he passed away in an accident, but that isn't what really happened.[p_]

text.key: 色んな人の恨みを買っていたらしいです…。[p_]
text.en-US: Many people held a grudge against him...[p_]

text.key: 私を飼っていた人、[r]
text.en-US: The person who owned me before... [r]

text.key: 私の前にも何人か痛めつけて楽しむための奴隷を買ってたらしいです。[p_]
text.en-US: Apparently he had many slaves before me that he loved to torment.[p_]

text.key: …事件が起こるタイミングがもう少し遅かったら、[r]
text.en-US: ...If that incident didn't happen at that time, [r]

text.key: 私もその人たちと同じことになってたかもしれません。[p_]
text.en-US: I may have ended up like those people.[p_]

text.key: 物心つく頃から私は一人で、家族と言うものを知りません。[lr_]
text.en-US: By the time I was aware of my surroundings I didn't have anything like family. [lr_]

text.key: …[name]を、家族のように思ったら、ご迷惑でしょうか？[p_]
text.en-US: ...Would it be a bother if I thought of you like family, [name]?[p_]

text.key: 私の体、貧相だけど、嫌いじゃないですか？[lr_]
text.en-US: My body's really thin, but... do you hate it? [lr_]

text.key: まだ、成長はすると思いますから…。[p_]
text.en-US: I think I will still develop some more, but...[p_]

text.key: [name]を思うと、楽しくて。[lr_]
text.en-US: When I think about [name] I feel happy. [lr_]

text.key: 幸せすぎて苦しくもなります。[p_]
text.en-US: I feel so happy it hurts.[p_]

text.key: [name]…。[lr_]
text.en-US: [name]... [lr_]

text.key: 抱きしめて…くれませんか？[p_]
text.en-US: Will you... hug me?[p_]

text.key: [xy tg1='*talk_b_loop'  tg2='*talk_room_b' ]
（突然唇を重ねられた[p_]
text.en-US: (She suddenly kissed me.[p_]

text.key: こうして一緒にいるだけで、体が火照るような…。[p_]
text.en-US: My body feels like it's burning up just by being together...[p_]

text.key: 私は、[name]のものです。[lr_]
text.en-US: I belong to [name]. [lr_]

text.key: 心も、体も…。[p_]
text.en-US: In both body and soul...[p_]

text.key: 普通の家庭に生まれていたら、辛い過去はなかったのかもしれません。[lr_]
text.en-US: If I had been born into a normal household I may not have had such an unfortunate past. [lr_]

text.key: でも、そうしたら[name]ともきっと会えなかった。[p_]
text.en-US: But, if that were the case then I would have never met you, [name].[p_]

text.key: そう考えたら、みなしごでよかったのかもって思います。[p_]
text.en-US: When I think like that, I feel like it was a good thing I was an orphan.[p_]

text.key: [name]といれば、どこにいても何をしていても幸せです。[p_]
text.en-US: If I'm together with [name], I'll be happy no matter where we are or what we do.[p_]

text.key: [name]といると、昔のことなんてどうでもよくなります。[p_]
text.en-US: When I'm together with [name], the past feels like it doesn't matter anymore.[p_]

text.key: 美味しいです。[p_]
text.en-US: It's good.[p_]

text.key: いい香りのお茶ですね。[lr_]
text.en-US: The tea smells very nice. [lr_]

text.key: すごく落ち着きます。[p_]
text.en-US: It's very relaxing.[p_]

text.key: ハーブの香りが強めのお茶ですね、[lr_]
text.en-US: The tea smells strongly of herbs, [lr_]

text.key: でも嫌いじゃないです。[p_]
text.en-US: but I don't dislike it.[p_]
...Phew.[p_]

text.key: あ、すいません。[lr_]
text.en-US: Ah, I'm sorry. [lr_]

text.key: 温まったらなんだか眠くなってきちゃいました…。[p_]
text.en-US: After I warmed up drinking the tea I began to feel a little sleepy...[p_]

text.key: ほんのり甘い香りのするお茶ですね。[lr_]
text.en-US: The tea has a slightly sweet smell. [lr_]

text.key: あったかくて美味しい…。[p_]
text.en-US: It's warm and delicious...[p_]

text.key: 甘い香りがして、美味しいですね。[lr_]
text.en-US: It has a sweet smell to it, and it tastes good. [lr_]

text.key: なんだか体が温まってきました。[p_]
text.en-US: It feels like it's warming me up.[p_]

text.key: 甘くて美味しいですね。[lr_]
text.en-US: It's sweet and delicious. [lr_]

text.key: …でも勢いよく飲んじゃったからかな、[r]
text.en-US: ...Maybe it's because I drank it too quickly, [r]

text.key: ちょっと暑くなってきちゃいました。[p_]
text.en-US: but I'm starting to feel a bit hot.[p_]

text.key: 部屋が暑くなったわけじゃないですよね。[p_]
text.en-US: It's not that the room has gotten hotter, is it?[p_]

text.key: お茶ですか？[lr_]
text.en-US: Tea? [lr_]

text.key: はい、
text.en-US: &'Yes, '

text.key: じゃあさっき[name]が買ってきてくださった[r]
text.en-US: let's have it together with the

text.key: [miyage]も一緒にいただきましょう。[p_]
text.en-US: _ [miyage] that [name] bought today.[p_]

text.key: 私が準備しますから[name]は待っていてください。[p_]
text.en-US: I will prepare everything, [name], so please wait a moment.[p_]

text.key: （しばらくするとシルヴィが二人分のティーセットを持ってキッチンから戻ってきた。[p_]
text.en-US: (After a short while, Sylvie comes back from the kitchen with a tea set for two.[p_]

text.key: おまたせしました。[lr_]
text.en-US: Thank you for waiting. [lr_]

text.key: じゃあいただきましょう。[p_]
text.en-US: Let's enjoy.[p_]

text.key: 最初の頃はこうして[name]と同じものを口にすることに不安しか感じませんでした。[p_]
text.en-US: At first I only felt anxious drinking the same thing that [name] drinks.[p_]

text.key: でも、今感じるのは、温もりと、安心と、幸せです…。[p_]
text.en-US: But all I feel now are warmth, peace of mind, and happiness...[p_]

text.key: 落ち着きますね…。[p_]
text.en-US: This really calms me down...[p_]

text.key: お茶だけじゃなくて、[name]と一緒だからですよ？[p_]
text.en-US: Not just because of the tea, but also because I'm with [name].[p_]
Phew...[p_]

text.key: ただ大好きな人と一緒にお茶を飲むだけで、[r]
text.en-US: To think I can feel such warmth, [r]

text.key: こんなにも暖かな気持ちになれるんですね。[p_]
text.en-US: just by drinking tea with the person I like.[p_]

text.key: あちっ…[p_]
text.en-US: Hot...[p_]

text.key: あ、大丈夫です。ちょっと勢いよく飲んじゃって。[p_]
text.en-US: Ah, I'm fine. I just drank a bit too quickly.[p_]

text.key: [name]も気をつけてください。[p_]
text.en-US: [name] should also be careful.[p_]

text.key: ふぅー… ふぅー…。[p_]
text.en-US: Fuuu... Fuuu...[p_]

text.key: ん、少し薄いかな…。[lr_]
text.en-US: Mm, the flavor is a little weak... [lr_]

text.key: ごめんなさい。[r]葉っぱの量かお湯の温度が悪かったのかな。[p_]
text.en-US: I'm sorry. [r]It seems like I made a mistake with the amount of tea leaves or the temperature of the water.[p_]

text.key: …おいしい…ですか？[lr_]
text.en-US: ...It... tastes good? [lr_]

text.key: ならいいんですけど。[p_]
text.en-US: It's fine if that is the case.[p_]

text.key: 次はもっと美味しく淹れますね。[p_]
text.en-US: I'll make it a lot better next time.[p_]

text.key: ちょっと、お砂糖入れてもいいでしょうか？[lr_]
text.en-US: Is it fine if I add a little sugar? [lr_]

text.key: ストレートも好きですけど、なんだか甘いのが飲みたい気分で…。[p_]
text.en-US: I like drinking it straight, but I feel like drinking something a little sweet...[p_]

text.key: ふふっ…甘い…♡[p_]
text.en-US: Hehe... It's sweet...♡[p_]

text.key: お茶も美味しいですけど、他になにかお菓子とかがあってもいいですよね。[p_]
text.en-US: The tea is delicious, but it would also be nice to have some snacks to go along with it, [r]wouldn't it?[p_]

text.key: いつかおいしいお菓子を作れるようになって[r]
text.en-US: Someday, I'd like to make tasty snacks [r]

text.key: [name]と一緒に楽しめたらなって、夢見ちゃいます…。[p_]
text.en-US: and have fun eating them with [name]...[p_]

text.key: なんて、贅沢すぎますよね…[p_]
text.en-US: Maybe it's too extravagant...[p_]

text.key: ふぅ…。[lr_]
text.en-US: Fuuu... [lr_]

text.key: こんな穏やかな時間、昔は想像もできませんでした。[p_]
text.en-US: I couldn't even imagine a peaceful time like this before.[p_]

text.key: 今の幸せを噛み締めてると、たまに涙が出そうになります…。[p_]
text.en-US: When I think about how happy I feel now, I get teary-eyed...[p_]

text.key: クッキー、お茶のお供にはぴったりですね。[lr_]
text.en-US: Cookies are the perfect thing to have with tea, aren't they? [lr_]

text.key: ん…。[lr]
text.en-US: Mn... [lr]

text.key: おいしい…。[p_]
text.en-US: Delicious...[p_]

text.key: （サクサク…）[p]
text.en-US: (It's crispy...)[p]

text.key: …あっ、ごめんなさい。[lr_]
text.en-US: ...Ah, I'm sorry. [lr_]

text.key: こんなに勢いよく食べたら[name]の分がなくなっちゃいますね。[p_]
text.en-US: If I eat so much there won't be any left for [name], huh?[p_]

text.key: ん…サクサクしてておいしい。[lr_]
text.en-US: Mm...it's crunchy and delicious. [lr_]

text.key: 普通のパンでもひと手間加えるだけでおいしいお菓子になるんですね。[p_]
text.en-US: Just by putting a little care into regular bread it can become a tasty snack.[p_]

text.key: これぐらいなら私でもすぐ作れるようになるかな…。[p_]
text.en-US: I wonder if even I could learn to make this...[p_]

text.key: …あむ。[lr]
text.en-US: ...nom. [lr]

text.key: ふふっ…おいしい。[p_]
text.en-US: Hehe... it's tasty![p_]

text.key: お店で食べるのも雰囲気があっていいですけど、[r]
text.en-US: Eating at the restaurant has a certain pleasant feel to it, [r]

text.key: やっぱり[name]と二人きりのほうが少し落ち着くような気がします。[p_]
text.en-US: but eating with [name] alone is really quite calming.[p_]

text.key: …あむ。[l]
text.en-US: ...nom. [l]

text.key: おいしい。[lr_]
text.en-US: Tasty. [lr_]

text.key: ほろ苦いチョコレートとお茶の香りがよく合いますね。[p_]
text.en-US: The bittersweet chocolate and the tea's aroma go quite well together.[p_]

text.key: ナッツのおかげで食感も少し面白いですし、[r]
text.en-US: The nuts make the texture a little more interesting, [r]

text.key: ケーキよりもしっかりした生地だからなおさらお茶がおいしい気がします。[p_]
text.en-US: and it's more flavorful than cake, so it makes the tea taste that much better.[p_]

text.key: プリンだとストレートの紅茶でちょうどいいですね。[lr_]
text.en-US: Straight black tea would be better with custard, wouldn't it? [lr_]

text.key: 間にお茶を挟まないで食べたらすぐなくなっちゃいそうです。[p_]
text.en-US: If I don't stop to drink some tea I think I'll finish it all at once.[p_]

text.key: あむ…。[l]
text.en-US: _*munch*... [l]

text.key: …おいしい。[p_]
text.en-US: ...Tasty.[p_]

text.key: いろんなフルーツをちょっとずつ楽しめるのがいいですね。[p_]
text.en-US: Enjoying each of the fruits individually is probably best.[p_]

text.key: こんなにたくさんの種類のフルーツを普通に買ったら傷む前に食べきれないですし、[lr_]
text.en-US: If you bought this many different fruits normally they'd spoil before you ate them all, [lr_]

text.key: スイーツになってると同じフルーツでも違った味に感じます。[p_]
text.en-US: and even if they didn't they'd taste differently from when they're part of this dessert.[p_]

text.key: …はむ。[l]
text.en-US: ...nom. [l]

text.key: んふ、おぃひぃです…。[p]
text.en-US: Mmf, ifs tayfy...[p]

text.key: ん…こくん。[lr_]
text.en-US: Mm... *gulp* [lr_]

text.key: すいません、行儀が悪かったですね。[p_]
text.en-US: I'm sorry, that was poor manners wasn't it.[p_]

text.key: でも、口いっぱいに甘いものを頬張るとつい気持ちもほころんじゃいます。[p_]
text.en-US: But to have such sweetness fill my mouth just makes me so happy I can't help it.[p_]

text.key: ふわふわで、クリームとチョコレートが口の中で混ざって…。[p_]
text.en-US: It's so fluffy, and the way the cream and chocolate mix in your mouth...[p_]

text.key: ふわふわな舌触りで美味しい…。[p_]
text.en-US: It's so chewy and tasty...[p_]

text.key: 派手さはないけど優しい味がします。[lr_]
text.en-US: It's not fancy-looking, but it tastes very soft. [lr_]

text.key: スポンジがしっとりしてるから軽いお菓子に比べて結構食べた気になりますね。[p_]
text.en-US: The sponginess absorbs everything, so it's pretty filling for a light snack.[p_]

text.key: はむ。[p]
text.en-US: Nom.[p]

text.key: んー、軽い生地とたっぷりのクリーム、[lr_]
text.en-US: Mmm, this light texture, this abundance of cream... [lr_]

text.key: これだけの組み合わせでこんなに美味しい…。[p_]
text.en-US: To think such a simple combination would be so tasty...[p_]

text.key: お菓子を考える人はすごいですね。[p_]
text.en-US: People who think up sweets sure are amazing.[p_]

text.key: 羊羹…これは異国のお菓子なんですよね？[lr_]
text.en-US: 'Youkan'... This is a snack from a foreign country, right? [lr_]

text.key: このあいだの「どら焼き」と同じ国のものなんですか。[p_]
text.en-US: Is it the same country that 'dorayaki' from before was from?[p_]

text.key: 黒くてツヤがあって…最初はチョコレートのゼリーみたいなものかと思いましたけど、[r]
text.en-US: It's black and shiny, so I thought it was chocolate jelly at first, [r]

text.key: チョコみたいな匂いじゃないし、なんだか違う気がしますね。[p_]
text.en-US: but it doesn't smell like chocolate so I doubt it is.[p_]

text.key: とにかく、頂いてみましょうか。[p_]
text.en-US: I guess I should just try some...[p_]

text.key: ん、甘い。[p_]
text.en-US: Mm, it's sweet.[p_]

text.key: このあいだの「どら焼き」と少し似てるのかな？[lr_]
text.en-US: It kinda tastes like that 'dorayaki' from the other day. [lr_]

text.key: 今まで食べたことのない味がします。[lr_]
text.en-US: It definitely is different from anything I've eaten before. [lr_]

text.key: 不思議な味だけど、美味しいですね。[p_]
text.en-US: It's a strange taste, but not in a bad way.[p_]

text.key: ずっしりしてる代わりに量は多くないし、[r]
text.en-US: It's thick, but there isn't as much of it, [r]

text.key: お茶を飲みながら少しずつ食べるのがいいのかな。[p_]
text.en-US: so eating it slowly with tea is probably best.[p_]

text.key: 珍しい味だけど、美味しいですね。[p_]
text.en-US: It's an unusual taste, but it's good.[p_]

text.key: 一口でたくさん口に入れないから[r]
text.en-US: You can't fit much into your mouth in one bite, [r]

text.key: 食べることより味を楽しむ感覚のほうが強い気がします。[lr_]
text.en-US: so I feel that savoring each bite slowly is best. [lr_]

text.key: そういう食べ物なんでしょうか？[p_]
text.en-US: Is this that sort of food?[p_]

text.key: どら焼き…これは異国のお菓子なんですよね？[lr_]
text.en-US: 'Dorayaki'... This is another foreign snack, isn't it? [lr_]

text.key: このあいだの「羊羹」と同じ国のものなんですか。[lr_]
text.en-US: Could it be the same country the 'youkan' from the other day was from? [lr_]

text.key: 小さなパンケーキみたいなので何か挟んであるみたいですね。[p_]
text.en-US: It looks like a tiny pancake, so perhaps there's something inside it?[p_]

text.key: じゃあ、頂いてみますね。[p_]
text.en-US: I'll try some now, then.[p_]

text.key: ん、スポンジ部分も甘いんだ…。[lr_]
text.en-US: Mm, the spongy bit tastes good too... [lr_]

text.key: 間には何か黒くて甘いものが、豆みたいのが入ってる？[p_]
text.en-US: In the middle is something black and sweet...that tastes like beans?[p_]

text.key: このあいだの「羊羹」と少し似てるのかな？[lr_]
text.en-US: It's almost like that 'youkan' from the other day. [lr_]

text.key: 何だか不思議な味ですね。[lr_]
text.en-US: What a strange taste it has. [lr_]

text.key: 結構好みかもしれません。美味しいです。[p_]
text.en-US: I might actually like it. It's tasty.[p_]

text.key: 美味しい。[p_]
text.en-US: Tasty.[p_]

text.key: このペースト状の甘い部分、[r]
text.en-US: This sweet paste part of it [r]

text.key: 他のお菓子にはない不思議な舌触りですね。[lr_]
text.en-US: has a completely different texture from any other snack I've had. [lr_]

text.key: 食べててちょっと面白いです。[p_]
text.en-US: What an interesting thing to eat.[p_]

text.key: シルヴィと一緒にティータイムを楽しんだ。[p]
はい、じゃあ着替えてきますね。[p_]
text.en-US: Thank you, I'll go change now, okay?[p_]

text.key: お仕事、頑張ってお手伝いします。[p_]
text.en-US: I'll do my best to help you with your work.[p_]

text.key: （シルヴィに仕事を少し手伝ってもらう事にした。[p_]
text.en-US: (I decided to have Sylvie help a little with my work.[p_]

text.key: [xy x='1075'  y='135'  y_add='89'  preg1='menu/s_menu/' ]
[btn/ l='y'  tg='*work_talk_lead'  g='1'  gr='conti' ]
[btn/ tg='*work_stop'  g='1'  gr='stop' ]
（今日はここら辺で切り上げよう…。[p_]
text.en-US: (Let's stop here for today...[p_]

text.key: 今日はおしまいですか？[p_]
text.en-US: Are we finished for today?[p_]

text.key: はい。お疲れ様でした、[name]。[p_]
text.en-US: Okay. You worked hard today, [name].[p_]

text.key: [xy tg1='*work_loop'  tg2='*work_talk' ]
[name]、この書類はどこにしまっておけばいいですか？[p_]
text.en-US: [name], where should I store this document?[p_]

text.key: お仕事といっても、それほど忙しくはなりませんね。[p_]
text.en-US: Even though it's work, it's not all that hectic, is it?[p_]

text.key: 平和な証拠だからいいことではありますけど。[p_]
text.en-US: It's proof that life here is peaceful, though, so that's a good thing.[p_]

text.key: いつかお薬の調合とかもきちんと覚えて、[lr_]
text.en-US: Someday I want to be able to properly make tea and such, [lr_]

text.key: もっとお役に立てるように…。[p_]
text.en-US: so that I can be of even greater use to you...[p_]

text.key: 棚を少し整理しておきますね。[p_]
text.en-US: I'll go organize the shelves, okay?[p_]

text.key: 傾いた書類や薬入れを直すぐらいで、順番は変えないように…。[p_]
text.en-US: Straightening the slanted files and medicine bottles, making sure not to mess up the order...[p_]

text.key: この棚少しほこりっぽいですね。[p_]
text.en-US: This shelf seems a little dusty.[p_]

text.key: 軽く掃除しておきます。[p_]
text.en-US: I'll go clean it gently.[p_]

text.key: 今日は確か診察の予約が入ってるんでしたよね。[p_]
text.en-US: Today you have a check-up scheduled, right?[p_]

text.key: カルテが…えっと、これかな？[p_]
text.en-US: The patient's record... um, was it this one?[p_]

text.key: まだ大したことはできないけど、[r]
text.en-US: I can't do very much yet, [r]

text.key: この服を着てるだけでもお手伝いできてる気分になっちゃいます。[p_]
text.en-US: but just wearing this uniform makes me feel like I can be of assistance.[p_]

text.key: …何かお手伝いすることはありませんか？[p_]
text.en-US: ...Is there anything I can help you with?[p_]

text.key: ガーゼの予備が少し減ってきましたね。[p_]
text.en-US: Our spare gauze is running low.[p_]

text.key: 今度買い足しに行きましょう。[p_]
text.en-US: We should go buy some more soon.[p_]

text.key: 私、少しは[name]のお役に立てているでしょうか？[p_]
text.en-US: I wonder, am I being useful to you, [name]?[p_]

text.key: 患者さんがいない日は時間持て余しちゃいますね。[p_]
text.en-US: Time sure does move slowly on days without patients...[p_]

text.key: うーん、お医者さんってやっぱり大変ですね…。[p_]
text.en-US: Hmm, it really is difficult to be a doctor, isn't it...?[p_]

text.key: （医学書を開いて難しい顔をしている。[lr_]
text.en-US: (She opens one of my medical journals and makes a troubled face. [lr_]

text.key: 予備知識なしで読んで分かるものではないだろう…。[p_]
text.en-US: I doubt it's comprehensible without a wealth of prerequisite knowledge.[p_]

text.key: 患者さんは多くないとはいえ、今までは[name]一人でこなしていたんですよね？[p_]
text.en-US: Even though there don't appear to be many patients, [r]you've managed on your own thus far, right [name]?[p_]

text.key: これからは私がお手伝いしますからね。[p_]
text.en-US: Don't worry, from now on I will help you.[p_]

text.key: この薬はこっちの棚にしまっておけばいいでしょうか？[p_]
text.en-US: Does this medicine belong on this shelf here?[p_]

text.key: 今は雑用ぐらいしかできませんけど、[r]
text.en-US: Right now I can only do odd jobs, [r]

text.key: いつか助手が務まるぐらいになれるよう頑張ります。[p_]
text.en-US: but I will try my best to be a proper assistant.[p_]

text.key: ん、同じ呼び方でいいんですか？[p_]
text.en-US: Mm, so you'd like me to call you the same thing?[p_]

text.key: じゃあこれからも[name]とお呼びしますね。[p_]
text.en-US: Okay, from now on I will call you [name].[p_]

text.key: はい。じゃあこれからは「[name]」ってお呼びしますね。[p_]
text.en-US: I understand. From now on, I will call you 「[name]」.[p_]

text.key: 私、兄弟はいませんけど。妹みたいに可愛がってくれたら嬉しいです。[lr_]
text.en-US: I... don't have any siblings, but if you could treat me like your little sister I would be really happy. [lr_]

text.key: [name]。[p_]
text.en-US: [name].[p_]
H・on・ey...♡[p_]

text.key: [name]…♡[p_]
娘のように思ってくれてるってことなんでしょうか。[p_]
text.en-US: I wonder if this means that you think of me like a daughter.[p_]

text.key: お医者さまですから、こう呼ばれるのが慣れているんでしょうか。[p_]
text.en-US: You are a doctor, so I suppose you are used to being addressed as such.[p_]

text.key: …なんの先輩なんでしょう？[p_]

text.en-US: but since coming here I've started to take better care of it.[p_]

text.key: できる限りの手入れはしているんですよ。[lr_]
text.en-US: I put as much love as I can into my hair. [lr_]

text.key: [name]に少しでも綺麗だって思って欲しいですから。[p_]
text.en-US: I want [name] to think I'm beautiful, after all...[p_]

text.key: …[name h='1' ]の意地悪。[p_]
text.en-US: ...[name h='1' ]'s being a meanie.[p_]

text.key: …だから、その♡[r]
[name h='1' ]の[Hxns n='p'  ex='1' ]欲しいんです♡♡[p_]
text.en-US: I want [name h='1' ]'s [Hxns n='p' ]♡♡[p_]

text.key: こんなにされたら、[Hxns n='v'  ex='1' ]疼いちゃって、私…♡[lr_]
text.en-US: When you do this my [Hxns n='v' ] starts to ache, and I...♡ [lr_]

text.key: [name h='1' ]…♡ベッドで[Hxns n='x'  ex='1' ]してください♡♡ね？[Hxns n='x'  ex='1' ]♡♡[p_]
text.en-US: [name h='1' ]...♡ Please have [Hxns n='x' ] with me on the bed♡♡[p_]

text.key: ただ触るだけじゃなくて、ベッドでその…[Hxns n='x'  ex='1' ]して欲しいです。[lr_]
text.en-US: Don't just touch me, I want you to have... [Hxns n='x' ] with me on the bed... [lr_]
...Do you also want that, [name h='1' ]?[p_]

text.key: [name]、そういうことをしたいならその…。[lr_]
text.en-US: [name], If you want to do that... [lr_]

text.key: ベッドで…♡[p_]
text.en-US: On the bed...♡[p_]

text.key: [xy x='895'  y='155'  y_add='85'  preg1='menu/room/s_menu/out_'  tg1='*talk_before_go' ]
[btn/ l='y'  tg='1'  g='1'  gr='town'  exp='f.tg[1]='town'' ]
[btn/ l='y'  tg='1'  g='1'  gr='forest'  exp='f.tg[1]='forest''  cond='f.state.step>=6' ]
[btn/ l='y'  tg='*alone'  g='1'  gr='alone' ]
[btn/ l='y'  tg='1'  g='1'  gr='dinner' ]
[btn/ l='y'  tg='*alone'  g='1'  gr='alone'  cond='f.state.lust>=50 || f.count.shop_n>=1' ]
[btn/ y='646'  tg='*remind_go'  g='1'  gr='remind' ]
（外を出歩ける服に着替えさせよう…。[p_]
text.en-US: (Let's get her dressed to go outside...[p_]

text.key: また、ご一緒して良いのですか？[p_]
text.en-US: Is it fine for me to accompany you again?[p_]

text.key: お出かけですか。[lr_]
text.en-US: Are you going out again? [lr_]

text.key: はい、ではご一緒させてもらいます。[p_]
text.en-US: Then, please allow me to accompany you.[p_]

text.key: はい、お出かけですか。[lr_]
text.en-US: Are you going out again? [lr_]

text.key: …楽しみです。[p_]
text.en-US: ...I'm looking forward to it.[p_]

text.key: 今日のご夕食は外でですか？[p_]
text.en-US: Are we going out for dinner today?[p_]

text.key: はい、わかりました。楽しみです。[p_]
text.en-US: All right, I understand. I'm looking forward to it.[p_]

text.key: はい、ご一緒させてください。[lr_]
text.en-US: Yes, please allow me to accompany you. [lr_]

text.key: どこへ行くときだって、おそばに…。[p_]
text.en-US: Wherever you go, I will always be with you...[p_]

text.key: はい。ご一緒します。[lr_]
text.en-US: Yes, I will go with you. [lr_]

text.key: [name]と一緒なら、どこにいても楽しいですから。[p_]
text.en-US: If I am together with [name], anywhere is fine.[p_]

text.key: （広場の方に戻ってきた。[p]
text.en-US: (Let's go back to the square.[p]

text.key: 街に来たが、どこへ行こう。[l]
text.en-US: We've arrived in town, but where should we go next? [l]

text.key: [btn/ l='y'  tg='*hiroba_re'  g='1'  gr='rest_town' ]
[btn/ l='y'  tg='*hiroba_re'  g='1'  gr='talk' ]
[btn/ l='y'  tg='*market'  g='1'  gr='market' ]
[btn/ l='y'  exp='f.st[0]='talk/d_shop',f.tg[0]='*d_shop''  g='1'  gr='dress_shop' ]
[btn/ l='y'  tg='*back_home'  g='1'  gr='go_home' ]
[btn/ l='y'  tg='*go_home'  g='1'  gr='go_home' ]
（生活に必要なものだけ買って今日は帰ろう…。[p_]
text.en-US: (I'll just buy some necessities and go home for today...[p_]

text.key: 噴水の淵にシルヴィと腰かけ少しゆったりしよう。[p_]
text.en-US: Sylvie and I relax on the bench carved into the side of the fountain.[p_]

text.key: [xy tg1='*hiroba_loop'  tg2='*hiroba_talk' ]
こうして、街に出て落ち着けるのはなんだか新鮮です。[lr_]
text.en-US: Going into town and merely relaxing like this is kind of refreshing. [lr_]

text.key: [name]のところに来るまではそういう機会ってありませんでしたから。[p_]
text.en-US: I never had a chance to do such a thing until I came to live with you after all, [name].[p_]

text.key: 市場の方に比べてここら辺は人の流れが緩やかですね。[p_]
text.en-US: Compared to the market, the flow of people seems to be more calm here.[p_]

text.key: …こうして街の風景を眺めるのってなんだか不思議な感じですね。[p_]
text.en-US: ...Just watching the world go by like this feels kind of strange.[p_]

text.key: この世界は広くてたくさんの人がいろんな生き方をしているんですね。[lr_]
text.en-US: You can't help but realize how big the world is, [r]and how many people are living their own lives in it. [p_]

text.key: 私が[name]のところに来るまでの生活は狭くて不自由で、[r]
text.en-US: My life before meeting [name] was narrow and restrictive, [r]

text.key: 知ってはいてもそういう実感がなかったです。[p_]
text.en-US: so even if I knew those things, I had no sense of reality about them.[p_]

text.key: 人ごみの中でも[name]が隣にいると、そんなに不安にならないで済みます。[p_]
text.en-US: Even in a crowded place like this, as long as [name] is by my side I can stay relaxed.[p_]

text.key: あんまり出歩くことってなかったから、長く歩くと少し疲れちゃいますね。[lr_]
text.en-US: I never really had much chance to walk outside, [r]so walking for a long time makes me kind of tired. [p_]

text.key: でも、腰を下ろして初めてそれに気がつくぐらい[name]と一緒にお出かけするのは楽しいです。[p_]
text.en-US: But having the chance to rest my legs and enjoy myself is all because I'm with you, [name].[p_]

text.key: 噴水が綺麗ですね。[p_]
text.en-US: The fountain sure is pretty.[p_]

text.key: 水が噴き出して流れて…[r]
text.en-US: All it's doing is spraying water everywhere... [r]

text.key: それだけなのになんだかぼうっといつまでも眺めてしまいそう。[p_]
text.en-US: And yet I feel like I could space out and watch it forever.[p_]

text.key: 噴水ってこの街に来て初めて見ました。[lr_]
text.en-US: Coming to this town is the first time I've seen a fountain. [lr_]

text.key: 私が昔いたところにもあったのかな…。[p_]
text.en-US: I wonder if there was one where I was living before...[p_]

text.key: ほとんど街の様子を見る機会はなかったから、私が知らなかっただけかも。[p_]
text.en-US: I never really had a chance to look around that town, [r]so it could just be I was never aware of one being there.[p_]

text.key: この街はなんだか不思議な雰囲気ですね。[lr_]
text.en-US: This town has a kind of strange atmosphere to it, doesn't it? [lr_]

text.key: 建物もたくさんあって、人の流れも遅くはないけど、[r]
text.en-US: There are lots of buildings, and the flow of people is anything but slow, [r]

text.key: なんだかゆっくり時間が流れてるみたいです。[p_]
text.en-US: yet time seems to flow relatively slowly here.[p_]

text.key: …[name][p_]
（シルヴィはそっとこちらの手を握ってきた。[p_]
text.en-US: (Sylvie gently squeezed my hand.[p_]

text.key: よく見るとこの街にも貧困の差はあるみたいですね。[lr_]
text.en-US: Looking again, this town has its rich and poor as well, doesn't it? [lr_]

text.key: でも、たまにお金持ちが目立つぐらいで、生活に困っていそうな人はあまり見ませんね。[p_]
text.en-US: But it's more like occasionally the rich stand out, rather than the poor being unable to live.[p_]

text.key: 昔は、「この人もひどいことをする怖い人かも」って、[r]
text.en-US: In the past I might have assumed that someone was going to do terrible things to me, [r]

text.key: 知らない人が目に入る度に怖がってました。[p_]
text.en-US: so whenever I got caught in a stranger's gaze I became frightened.[p_]

text.key: 今もそういうことがなくなったわけじゃ無いけど、[r]
text.en-US: It's not like that fear has completely disappeared, [r]

text.key: 隣に[name]がいれば少し安心できます。[p_]
text.en-US: but as long as [name] is by my side I can find my calm.[p_]

text.key: お店を見て回るのも楽しいですけど、[r]
text.en-US: Wandering around the different shops and such is fun too, but [r]

text.key: こうして人通りの少ないところをゆっくり歩いたり、座って休憩したりする方が落ち着きますね。[p_]
text.en-US: wandering around a spot like this with less people and stopping to rest is much more calming.[p_]

text.key: 今の私ならこうして街を歩く人たちと同じように見えるんでしょうか。[lr_]
text.en-US: I wonder if I blend in with all the people around us now? [lr_]

text.key: 誰かの奴隷じゃない、普通の人に。[p_]
text.en-US: Not as a slave, but as a normal person.[p_]

text.key: [name]のお家は街から少し外れたところにありますよね。[lr_]
text.en-US: [name]'s home is kind of removed from town, isn't it? [lr_]

text.key: 人の多いところに住むとやっぱり大変なこともあるんでしょうか？[p_]
text.en-US: I wonder, is it because living surrounded by lots of people is troublesome?[p_]

text.key: 私がいた施設のあった街とは全然違う景色です。[p_]
text.en-US: The landscape here is completely different from that of where the facility I was living in before was.[p_]

text.key: あの街は怖い顔やくたびれた顔をした人が多くて、[r]
text.en-US: That town had lots of people with scary faces or tired faces, [r]

text.key: 時々怒鳴り声や喧嘩の音が聞こえてきました。[lr_]
text.en-US: and occasionally you could hear screams or the sound of people fighting. [p_]

text.key: 自由に出かけられたとしてもあまり出歩きたいとは思わなかったですね…。[p_]
text.en-US: Even if I had been able to walk around freely, I don't think I would've [r]wanted to wander around that place...[p_]

text.key: 路上で楽器を弾いている人がいますね。[lr_]
text.en-US: There's someone playing an instrument on that street. [lr_]

text.key: 多分ヴァイオリン…ですよね？[p_]
text.en-US: It's a violin... I think?[p_]

text.key: 音楽や楽器のことは良くわからないですけど、綺麗な音ですね。[p_]
text.en-US: I don't know much about music or musical instruments, but it sounds very pretty.[p_]

text.key: （そよ風がシルヴィの髪を揺らしている[p_]
text.en-US: (The gentle wind brushes through Sylvie's hair.[p_]

text.key: （シルヴィは噴水に腰掛けて地についていない足をフラフラさせている。[p_]
text.en-US: (Sylvie is sitting on the fountain, her legs swinging in the air.[p_]

text.key: （向かい側から吹いたそよ風を感じてシルヴィは少し目を閉じていた。[p_]
text.en-US: (The breeze coming towards us makes Sylvie squint her eyes a little bit.[p_]

text.key: （食品から加工品までいろんなものが売っている市場へ来た。[p_]
text.en-US: (We arrived at the market selling everything from foodstuffs to manufactured goods.[p_]

text.key: （普段は買い物は近場で済ませているが、[r]
text.en-US: (I usually shop somewhere closer, [r]

text.key: シルヴィと一緒なら珍しいものを眺めるだけでも楽しめるだろう。[p_]
text.en-US: but since I'm together with Sylvie I'm sure she can enjoy herself seeing some unusual things.[p_]

text.key: こんな市場があったんですね。[lr_]
text.en-US: So there was a market like this. [lr_]

text.key: 人がたくさん…。[p_]
text.en-US: There are so many people...[p_]

text.key: いろんなものがありそうですね。[p_]
text.en-US: It looks like there are a lot of things.[p_]

text.key: （市場の方に来た。[p_]
text.en-US: (We've arrived at the market.[p_]

text.key: [btn/ l='y'  tg='*market_re'  g='1'  gr='look_around' ]
[btn/ l='y'  tg='*return_to_town'  g='1'  gr='return_center' ]
[xy tg1='*market_loop'  tg2='*talk_market' ]
お酒を売っているところもあるんですね。[p_]
text.en-US: So there are places that sell alcohol too.[p_]

text.key: 私でも飲めそうなのはあるかな？[p_]
text.en-US: I wonder if they have something even I might be able to drink?[p_]

text.key: 私はお酒飲んだことはないですけど、おいしいんですよね？[p_]
text.en-US: I've never drank alcohol before, but is it good?[p_]

text.key: いつか大きくなったら飲んでみたいです。[p_]
text.en-US: Once I grow up I'd like to try tasting it.[p_]

text.key: このお芋？長くて赤いですね。[p_]
text.en-US: What is this potato? It's long and red.[p_]

text.key: サツマイモ？[lr_]
text.en-US: Sweet potato? [lr_]

text.key: お芋で、甘いんですか？[p_]
text.en-US: It's a potato, but it's sweet?[p_]

text.key: どんな風に料理するんでしょう…。[p_]
text.en-US: I wonder how you're supposed to cook this...[p_]

text.key: トマトが売ってますね。[p_]
text.en-US: They're selling tomatoes here.[p_]

text.key: 生のトマトは…、そんなに好きじゃないなぁ。[p_]
text.en-US: I don't like... raw tomatoes very much.[p_]

text.key: トマトソースとかは大丈夫なんですけど。[p_]
text.en-US: I'm okay with tomato sauce, though.[p_]

text.key: コーヒーのいい香り…。[lr_]
text.en-US: The scent of coffee... [lr_]

text.key: 豆が売ってるんですね。[p_]
text.en-US: They seem to be selling coffee beans.[p_]

text.key: 匂いはこんなにいい匂いなのに、コーヒーそのものはあんなに苦いなんて…。[p_]
text.en-US: The smell itself is nice, but coffee is so bitter...[p_]

text.key: 美味しそうに飲める人が羨ましいです。[p_]
text.en-US: I'm jealous of people who enjoy drinking it.[p_]

text.key: ニンジンが並んでる…。[p_]
text.en-US: Carrots are lined up here...[p_]

text.key: ニンジンって植物の根っこなんですよね？[lr_]
text.en-US: Carrots are the roots of a plant, right? [lr_]

text.key: オレンジ色の根っこなんて、不思議ですね。[p_]
text.en-US: The roots are orange... How strange.[p_]

text.key: いろんな色のパプリカが…。[p_]
text.en-US: There's various colored paprika here...[p_]

text.key: 同じパプリカなのにいろんな色があって面白いですね。[p_]
text.en-US: It's funny how they're all paprika but they have many different colors.[p_]

text.key: しかも絵の具で塗ったみたいな派手な色。[lr_]
text.en-US: And they're flashy colors like those in a painting. [lr_]

text.key: 絵の具を肥料にしてる…わけないか。[p_]
text.en-US: Maybe they use it for paint...? Of course not.[p_]

text.key: 人がたくさんですね。[lr_]
text.en-US: There are a lot of people. [lr_]

text.key: 手、少し強く握ってもいいですか？[p_]
text.en-US: Is it... okay if I hold your hand a little harder?[p_]

text.key: いろんなものが売ってますね。[lr_]
text.en-US: They are selling a lot of different things here. [lr_]

text.key: 野菜、果物、保存食に小物まで。[p_]
text.en-US: Vegetables, fruits, preserved foods, and accessories.[p_]

text.key: 棚の上がカラフルで、いろんな匂いもする…。[p_]
text.en-US: The top shelf is colorful, and there are various smells...[p_]

text.key: 玉ねぎがたくさん。[lr_]
text.en-US: So many onions. [lr_]

text.key: いろんなお料理に使えるんですよね？[p_]
text.en-US: You can use them for various dishes, right?[p_]

text.key: いつか私も色々作れるようになりたいです。[p_]
text.en-US: I want to be able to cook many dishes someday.[p_]

text.key: おっきなかぼちゃ。[p_]
text.en-US: What a big pumpkin.[p_]

text.key: パイにするぐらいしか料理が思いつかないんですけど、[r]
text.en-US: The only way I know you can cook this is use it in a pie, [r]

text.key: 他にも何かあるんでしょうか？[p_]
text.en-US: but there are other dishes you can make, right?[p_]

text.key: 一個全部パイにしたら私と[name]だけじゃ食べ切れませんね。[p_]
text.en-US: If we turned the whole pumpkin into a pie, I don't think just [name] and I will be able to eat it all.[p_]

text.key: スパイスがたくさん並んでますね。[p_]
text.en-US: There are a lot of spices lined up.[p_]

text.key: ほんのちょっとならいい香りだけど、[r]
text.en-US: It smells nice if it's only a little, [r]

text.key: こんなにたくさんだと匂いも濃いですね。[p_]
text.en-US: but with this much the smell is too strong.[p_]

text.key: いろんな匂いがして目眩がしそうです。[p_]
text.en-US: All these different smells are making me dizzy.[p_]

text.key: セロリだ。…正直あんまり好きじゃないです。[p_]
text.en-US: It's celery.... I don't like it very much to be honest.[p_]

text.key: アスパラとかも、青臭いっていうんでしょうか？[lr_]
text.en-US: Asparagus, too. How do I say it? They smell grassy? [lr_]

text.key: 草みたいな香りが苦手で…。[p_]
text.en-US: I don't like that grassy smell very much...[p_]

text.key: あ、いろんなジャムが並んでる…。[p_]
text.en-US: Ah, they're selling various jams here...[p_]

text.key: 瓶に入ったジャムは綺麗でいろんな色があって、[r]
text.en-US: There are so many different colored jars of jam. [r]

text.key: 味を想像するのも楽しいし、ワクワクしちゃいます。[p_]
text.en-US: Just imagining the different flavours is making me excited.[p_]

text.key: あ、オレンジが落っこちて…。[lr_]
text.en-US: Ah, an orange fell... [lr_]

text.key: よいしょ、[p_]
text.en-US: Heave ho...[p_]

text.key: 元の場所に戻しておきましょう。[p_]
text.en-US: Let's put it back where it was.[p_]

text.key: これはオレンジ[lr_]
text.en-US: This is... [lr_]

text.key: …じゃないですね。[p_]
text.en-US: ...Not an orange.[p_]

text.key: みかん？[lr_]
text.en-US: Mandarin orange? [lr_]

text.key: オレンジより小さいけど、おいしいんでしょうか？[p_]
text.en-US: It's smaller than a regular orange, but does it taste good?[p_]

text.key: 真っ赤なりんご、いい香りがしますね。[p_]
text.en-US: A bright red apple. It has a nice smell.[p_]

text.key: りんごってこうして並んでるのを見ると、[r]
text.en-US: When I see apples displayed like this, [r]

text.key: カットしないでそのまま齧ってみたくなります[p_]
text.en-US: it makes me want to eat them whole instead of cutting them.[p_]

text.key: あ、メロンが安いですね。[p_]
text.en-US: Ah, melons are on sale.[p_]

text.key: でも荷物になっちゃうし[r]
text.en-US: But it'd be a burden, [r]

text.key: お散歩ついでに買えるものじゃないですね。[p_]
text.en-US: so we should only buy things we can carry easily.[p_]

text.key: 丸ごとのパイナップル…おっきいですね。[p_]
text.en-US: A whole pineapple... It's big.[p_]

text.key: これ、そのまま買って帰っても剥くのが大変そう…。[lr_]
text.en-US: Even if we bought it, it seems like it would be troublesome to peel and cut... [lr_]

text.key: 特別な道具とかなくても剥けるのかな。[p_]
text.en-US: I wonder if you can peel it without special utensils.[p_]

text.key: ぶどうがたくさん並んでますね…。[p_]
text.en-US: There are a lot of grapes...[p_]

text.key: え、一つ味見してもいいんですか？[p_]
text.en-US: Eh? I can taste one?[p_]
...Mm, sweet...♡[p_]

text.key: イチゴがたくさん。[p_]
text.en-US: There are a lot of strawberries.[p_]

text.key: そのまま食べても美味しそうだけど…[lr_]
text.en-US: It would be tasty just eating it as is... [lr_]

text.key: ケーキのイチゴ思い出しちゃいます。[p_]
text.en-US: It reminds me of the strawberry on the cake.[p_]

text.key: 面白い形の果物？ですね。[lr_]
text.en-US: It looks like a white colored fruit? [lr_]

text.key: スターフルーツ？[p_]
text.en-US: Starfruit?[p_]

text.key: あ、切ると星型になるんですね。面白い…。[p_]
text.en-US: Ah, because if you cut it it looks like a star. How interesting...[p_]

text.key: バナナが積んである。[p_]
text.en-US: There are bananas piled up here.[p_]

text.key: 刃物がいらないから食べやすくっていいですよね。[p_]
text.en-US: Bananas are nice and easy to eat because you don't need a knife.[p_]

text.key: マフィンやケーキにもできるらしいですよ。[lr_]
text.en-US: It seems like you can use them for muffins and cakes as well. [lr_]

text.key: [name]のためにいつか作ってみたいです。[p_]
text.en-US: I want to try making some for you, [name].[p_]

text.key: あ、さくらんぼ[lr_]
text.en-US: Ah, cherries! [lr_]

text.key: …じゃない。[p_]
text.en-US: ...Or not.[p_]

text.key: なんでしょうこれ？[lr_]
text.en-US: I wonder what this is? [lr_]

text.key: …アセロラ？[p_]
text.en-US: ...Acerola?[p_]

text.key: 香りもさくらんぼとはだいぶ違いますね。[lr_]
text.en-US: The smell is quite different from a cherry. [lr_]

text.key: おいしいのかな？[p_]
text.en-US: Does it taste good?[p_]

text.key: なんだかトゲトゲで堅そうなのが…。[lr_]
text.en-US: There's something that looks spikey and hard... [lr_]

text.key: これなんでしょう？[p_]
text.en-US: I wonder what this is?[p_]

text.key: ドリアン？[lr_]
text.en-US: Durian? [lr_]

text.key: …臭いけど、甘いんですか？[p_]
text.en-US: ...It's smelly, but it's sweet?[p_]

text.key: どんな味か想像しにくいですね…。[lr_]
text.en-US: It's hard to imagine what it tastes like... [lr_]

text.key: 食べてみたいような、みたくないような…。[p_]
text.en-US: I want to try eating it, yet at the same time I don't...[p_]

text.key: なんだかいろんな色があって綺麗だけど、これなんでしょう。[p_]
text.en-US: There are various colors and it looks pretty, but I wonder what this is.[p_]

text.key: あ、よく見たらロウソクですね。[p_]
text.en-US: Ah, now that I look closely they're candles.[p_]

text.key: アロマキャンドル？[lr_]
text.en-US: Aroma candle? [lr_]

text.key: あかりのためのロウソクとは違うんだ。[p_]
text.en-US: So they're different from candles used for light.[p_]

text.key: ガラスの食器が並んでますね。[p_]
text.en-US: There's glass tableware here.[p_]

text.key: キラキラしてて綺麗…。[p_]
text.en-US: The way they sparkle is beautiful...[p_]

text.key: でもここまで凝ったものだと、[r]
text.en-US: But the idea of using something [r]

text.key: 日常的に使うのはちょっと怖そうですね。[p_]
text.en-US: elaborate like this for everyday use is kind of scary.[p_]

text.key: あ、端の方に来ちゃいましたね。[lr_]
text.en-US: Ah, we've come close to the end. [lr_]

text.key: お店はここまでみたいです。[p_]
text.en-US: It seems like the shops end here.[p_]

text.key: 戻って別の方を見てみましょうか。[p_]
text.en-US: We should go back and go another direction.[p_]

text.key: あ、いろんなお茶が売ってますよ。[p_]
text.en-US: Ah, they're selling a lot of teas over here.[p_]

text.key: コーヒーは飲めないけど、[r]
text.en-US: I can't drink coffee, [r]

text.key: お茶なら飲めるから味を想像できて楽しいです。[p_]
text.en-US: but I can drink tea so it's fun imagining how these taste.[p_]

text.key: なんだか変な…置物？が売ってるみたいですね。[p_]
text.en-US: They're selling some strange... ornaments?[p_]

text.key: いろんなのがあって面白いけど…[r]
text.en-US: There are a lot of interesting looking things, but... [r]

text.key: どれもうちに飾ってもあまり合いそうにないですね。[p_]
text.en-US: None of them seem like they would fit in as decoration in the house.[p_]

text.key: なんだか香辛料の香りが…。[p_]
text.en-US: Something smells like spice...[p_]

text.key: あ、干し肉が売ってるんだ。[lr_]
text.en-US: Ah, they're selling dried meat. [lr_]

text.key: …結構値段するんですね。[p_]
text.en-US: ...It's quite pricey.[p_]

text.key: 自分で作るのも大変そうだし、手間を考えたらそんなものなのかな。[p_]
text.en-US: It seems like it would take a lot of time and effort, so I can understand the pricing.[p_]

text.key: （ちらほらと店じまいを始めるのが目に入る…。[lr_]
text.en-US: (I can see a lot of places closing up shop... [lr_]

text.key: （家のことをシルヴィに任せて買い出しに行こう。[p_]
text.en-US: (Let's leave Sylvie in charge of the house and go shopping.[p_]

text.key: もう日も傾いてますけど、お一人でお買物ですか？[p_]
text.en-US: It's quite late, but you're going shopping alone anyway?[p_]

text.key: お一人でお買物ですか？[p_]
text.en-US: Going shopping on your own?[p_]

text.key: …はい、行ってらっしゃいませ。[lr_]
text.en-US: ...Okay, have a safe trip. [lr_]

text.key: 大丈夫です、大丈夫…。[p_]
text.en-US: It's fine, I'll be fine...[p_]

text.key: すぐ、帰ってきますよね。[p_]
text.en-US: Please, come home soon, okay?[p_]

text.key: はい、行ってらっしゃいませ。[lr_]
text.en-US: Okay, have a safe trip. [lr_]

text.key: …おかえりをお待ちしてます。[p_]
text.en-US: ...I'll be awaiting your return.[p_]

text.key: お家のことは任せてください。[p_]
text.en-US: Please leave the house to me.[p_]

text.key: はい、行ってらっしゃいませ。お気をつけて。[p_]
text.en-US: Okay, have a safe trip. Be careful.[p_]

text.key: （必要なものは買い終わった。[lr]
text.en-US: (I finished buying what I needed. [lr]

text.key: ついでにどこかに寄っていこうか？
text.en-US: Should I drop by somewhere while I'm out?

text.key: [btn/ l='y'  exp='f.st[0]='talk/d_shop',f.tg[0]='*shop_night''  gr='ch/d_shop' ]
[btn/ l='y'  exp='f.st[0]='talk/cafe',f.tg[0]='*cafe_alone''  gr='ch/lunch' ]
[btn/ l='y'  tg='*back_home_alone'  gr='ch/back'  exp='f.item.miyage='nothing',f.daily.d_shop_n='not'' ]
（寄り道はしないでまっすぐ帰ろう。[p_]
text.en-US: (Let's head straight home without any detours.[p_]

text.key: （家のそばまで来るとドアが開きシルヴィが駆け寄ってきた。[p_]
text.en-US: (As I turned the corner towards my house, the front door flew open and Sylvie came running out.[p_]

text.key: …[name]っ。[p_]
（走ってきたシルヴィは立ち止まらずそのまま腕の中に飛び込んできた。[p_]
text.en-US: (Sylvie ran up and leapt into my arms without stopping.[p_]

text.key: …ぁ。ごめんなさい。[lr_]
text.en-US: ...Ah, I'm sorry. [lr_]

text.key: えっと、おかえりなさいです♡[p_]
text.en-US: Um, welcome back!♡[p_]

text.key: （家の前に来るとドアが開きシルヴィが駆け寄ってきた。[p_]
text.en-US: (As soon as I walked up to my house, the door flung open and Sylvie came running up to me.[p_]

text.key: おかえりなさい、[name]。[lr_]
text.en-US: Welcome home, [name]. [lr_]

text.key: あ、えっと…待ちきれなくって…。[p_]
text.en-US: Ah, um...I couldn't wait any longer, so...[p_]

text.key: （帰ってくるのを窓から様子を伺って待っていたようだ。[p_]
text.en-US: (It seems that she stayed at the window awaiting my return.[p_]

text.key: お買物はどうでしたか？[p_]
text.en-US: How did your shopping trip go?[p_]

text.key: （ノブに手をかける前にドアが開いた。[lr]
text.en-US: (Before I could put my hand on the knob the door swung open. [lr]

text.key: 帰ってくるのを窓から様子をうかがって待っていたようだ。[p_]
text.en-US: It seems that she stayed at the window awaiting my return.[p_]

text.key: あ、おかえりなさい、[name]。[lr_]
text.en-US: Ah, welcome home, [name]. [lr_]

text.key: （ドアを開けると小走りでシルヴィが玄関まで来て迎えてくれた。[p_]
text.en-US: (The moment I opened the door, Sylvie came trotting into the entryway to greet me.[p_]

text.key: あ、何か買ってきたんですか？[lr_]
text.en-US: Ah, you bought something? [lr_]
...For me?[p_]

text.key: これ…。[lr_]
text.en-US: This is... [lr_]

text.key: いえ、[name]が私に身につけてほしいなら…。[p_]
text.en-US: It's fine, if [name] wants me to put it on, then...[p_]

text.key: …はい、じゃあ後で♡[p_]
text.en-US: ...Okay, for later then♡[p_]

text.key: …はい、[name]の好みに飾ってください。[p_]
text.en-US: ...Yes, please decorate me as you wish, [name].[p_]

text.key: [name]が好きな私でいたいですから…♡[p_]
text.en-US: Because I want to remain the way [name] wants me to be...♡[p_]

text.key: …あ、[miyage]
text.en-US: ...Ah, you brought home[emb exp="' a'" cond="f.item.miyage!='cookies'" ] [miyage]

text.key: を買ってきてくれたんですか？[p_]
text.en-US: _ Did you buy [emb exp="'it'" cond="f.item.miyage!='cookies'" ][emb exp="'them'" cond="f.item.miyage=='cookies'" ] for me?[p_]

text.key: じゃあ、ご飯の後に一緒にいただきましょうか。[lr_]
text.en-US: Well then, let's have [emb exp="'it'" cond="f.item.miyage!='cookies'" ][emb exp="'them'" cond="f.item.miyage=='cookies'" ] after dinner. [lr_]

text.key: （買い物をしているとどこかで見たような背中が見えた。[l]
text.en-US: (While shopping I noticed the back of a man which looked quite familiar. [l]

text.key: [btn/ l='y'  tg='*call_Ferrum'  gr='ch/call' ][btn/ tg='*Ferrum_not_call'  gr='ch/stop' ]
（先に買い物を済ませよう…。[p]
text.en-US: (Let's finish shopping first...[p]

text.key: おや先生、お買い物ですか。[p]
text.en-US: Well if it isn't the good doctor. Out shopping?[p]

text.key: うちでも何か見ていきますか？[p]
text.en-US: Would you perhaps be interested in one of my wares?[p]

text.key: [xy x='925'  y='218'  y_add='64'  preg1='menu/s_menu/' ]
[btn/ l='y'  tg='*Ferrum_buy'  g='1'  gr='buy_drink' ]
[btn/ l='y'  tg='*Ferrum_lead'  g='1'  gr='talk'  exp='f.temp.shop_t=1' ]
[btn/ l='y'  tg='*Ferrum_go_home'  g='1'  gr='go_home' ]
（前に買ったのがまだ家に残っていたはずだ…。[p]
text.en-US: (I'm pretty sure the one I bought before is still at home...[p]

text.key: 了解しました。ではこちらを。[p]
text.en-US: Most certainly. Right this way, then.[p]

text.key: （梅酒を買った。[p]
text.en-US: (I bought a bottle of plum wine.[p]

text.key: では機会がありましたらまた。[p]
text.en-US: Well then, until the next time our paths cross.[p]

text.key: [xy tg1='*Ferrum_loop'  tg2='*talk_Ferrum' ]
ここはいい街ですね。[lr]
text.en-US: This is a wonderful little town, isn't it? [lr]

text.key: ちょいと変わったところもあるが基本的に平和だ。[p]
text.en-US: Certainly it's got its quirks, but it's basically peaceful.[p]

text.key: どこが変わってるか…ですか？[lr]
text.en-US: ...The quirks, you ask? [lr]

text.key: そりゃあ底抜けにお人好しな医者がいるのなんかは良い一例じゃないですかね。[p]
text.en-US: The existence of an unfathomably gullible doctor is one good example, is it not?[p]

text.key: 前にも申し上げたかもしれませんが、私の商売は扱う商品の幅広さが売りです。[p]
text.en-US: I believe I mentioned this before, but my business excels in its sheer variety of products.[p]

text.key: 異国のものや変わったものを取り扱うことがメインになるので競争相手が少ない分、[r]
text.en-US: My main focus is foreign goods and curiosities which does keep competition down, [r]

text.key: 少ない需要を求めている場所を探し回らないと商売が成立しない。[p]
text.en-US: but it also means if I don't find a place with ample demand for my wares, I can't do business.[p]

text.key: その点この街は大当たりですね。[lr]
text.en-US: In that sense, this city has been a massive boon for me. [lr]

text.key: それなりに金回りのいい豊さがあって、風変わりなものを扱いたがる商売人が多い。[p]
text.en-US: The local economy is strong, and there are many distributors interested [r]in the oddities I have to offer.[p]

text.key: 最近になって変わった商品を扱い始めた店に心当たりがあったら、[r]
text.en-US: Lately if you have even a suspicion about a shop selling strange things, [r]

text.key: そいつは十中八九私の商売相手ですね。[lr]
text.en-US: most likely they are indeed my customers. [lr]

text.key: 先生のお気に召したら私のためにも是非贔屓してやってください。[p]
text.en-US: If there's ever anything I may be able to provide, please do send your business my way.[p]

text.key: ここは平和な街に見えますね。[lr]
text.en-US: This town appears to be quite peaceful. [lr]

text.key: ただ、不気味に平和すぎるところも含めて変わった部分も多いようですが…。[p]
text.en-US: It's just that it's almost eerily peaceful, which isn't helped by the more... queer bits, shall we say.[p]

text.key: それなりに治安が安定した落ち着きのある街は需要も供給もいい意味で代わり映えせず。[lr]
text.en-US: Normally a town with peace and public order would mean no place for businesses such as mine, [lr]

text.key: 私のような変わり種を扱う商売人の出る幕はないってのがのがお決まりだったんですが、[r]
text.en-US: but for some strange reason,

text.key: どうもこの街は違うようです。[p]
text.en-US: _ this town is an exception to the rule.[p]

text.key: あっちこっち動き回っていたおかげで仕事の人脈はかなり広いほうです。[lr]
text.en-US: Wandering around here, I've found quite a few potentially profitable business connections. [lr]

text.key: 一般的な需要があるかはさておき、とても珍しいものも仕入れることができますね。[p]
text.en-US: With typical commodities aside, there are some truly unique items I could start stocking.[p]

text.key: とはいえ変な奇病でもはやらない限り医者に奇抜な商品は必要ないでしょうし、[r]
text.en-US: However, it's unlikely you'll be interested in my products [r]

text.key: 先生には商売で関わることはなさそうですがね。[p]
text.en-US: unless your patients have some strange illness and need unusual medicine.

text.key: 人が入れ替わり、金が回り、ものが消費される。[lr]
text.en-US: People change, money exchanges hands, goods are consumed. [lr]

text.key: 騒がしいが市場として正しい景色ですね。[p]
text.en-US: It may be noisy, but a market is truly the place to be.[p]

text.key: 私のこの積荷も、この市に商品として流れるわけだ。[p]
text.en-US: This luggage I'm carrying is wares I'm peddling at this market, you see.[p]

text.key: 私がここで取引してる商品はほとんどが国外からの輸入品ですね。[p]
text.en-US: The items I sell are almost entirely imported from foreign countries.[p]

text.key: 食品、酒、衣服に書物。[lr]
text.en-US: Foodstuffs, alcohol, clothing and even books. [lr]

text.key: 自分で言うのもなんですが、あまり一般向けでない風変わりなものが多い。[p]
text.en-US: It's perhaps not my place to say, but the majority are peculiarities [r]you won't find in common circulation.[p]

text.key: 私から商品を仕入れる商売人がいるってことはさらにそれを買う街の住人がいるわけで。[lr]
text.en-US: The fact that there are distributors here buying my wares means [r]there must also be citizens purchasing these goods from them. [lr]

text.key: 町中酔狂なやつで溢れてるんでしょう。[p]
text.en-US: I wonder if these streets will become awash with rabid drunkenness?[p]

text.key: 必要な買い物はあらかた済ませた。[lr]
text.en-US: I've done all the necessary shopping. [lr]

text.key: そろそろ帰路につくか、それとももう少し店を回ってもいいだろうか考えて足を止める。[p]
text.en-US: I stop and wonder whether I should go home or stay for a little longer and browse the stalls.[p]

text.key: おや、どうも先生。お買い物ですか。[p_]
text.en-US: Well if it isn't the good doctor. Out shopping?[p_]

text.key: （声をかけられて振り向くと、いつぞやの男が立っていた。[p_]
text.en-US: (I turn in the direction I heard the voice and see the man from that time.[p_]

text.key: お久しぶりです。あれ以来そちらはうまくいっていますか？[p]
text.en-US: Long time no see. Have you been doing well since then?[p]

text.key: （おそらくシルヴィのことを聞いているのだろう。[p_]
text.en-US: (He's probably referring to Sylvie.[p_]

text.key: …そうですか。それはよかった。[p]
text.en-US: ...Is that so? That's good.[p]

text.key: こちらも最近はこの辺りで商談がうまく進んでましてね。[lr_]
text.en-US: Negotiations have been going steadily around here recently. [lr_]

text.key: しかし今日はちょっとしたトラブルがありまして、[r]
text.en-US: However, I've encountered a bit of trouble today, [r]

text.key: 私がわざわざ積荷の一部を運ぶ羽目になっちまって…。[p_]
text.en-US: and I've been roped into carrying a part of the cargo...[p_]

text.key: 今は足を待ってるところなんですよ。[p_]
text.en-US: I'm waiting on them right now.[p_]

text.key: （男は隣に置いてある大きな荷物に手を置き少し不機嫌そうに顔をしかめた。[p_]
text.en-US: (The man makes an unpleasant face as he places his hand on the large luggage next to him.[p_]

text.key: そうだ、せっかくですから先生も何か見てみますか？[p_]
text.en-US: I know! Since we've bumped into each other, will you take a look around, doctor?[p_]

text.key: 私も暫くここから動けないし、[r]
text.en-US: I won't be able to move from here for a while, [r]

text.key: 手持ちの一部は買い手が決まってないものなんで欲しいものがあればお売りしますよ。[p_]
text.en-US: and we haven't found a buyer yet so if there's anything you want then I'm willing to sell.[p_]

text.key: 買うかどうかはどんなものがあるかによるが…。[p]
text.en-US: Whether I buy or not depends on what you have...[p]

text.key: 先生の興味の持ちそうなものは、そうだな…この中のものなんかどうでしょう？[p]
text.en-US: Something that would interest you... Let's see... What about something like this?[p]

text.key: 男は積荷の内比較的小ぶりなものを選び中身を見えるようにしてくれた。[lr]
text.en-US: The man chooses a relatively small piece of cargo and shows me its contents. [lr]

text.key: 文書の類が入っているもののようだ。[p]
text.en-US: It contains some kind of documents.[p]

text.key: これは全て国外の書物を訳したものですので、ここらでは珍しいもののはずです。[p]
text.en-US: All of these are translations of books from foreign countries, so they should be rather rare around here.[p]

text.key: 確かに一風変わったものが多いように見える。試しに一つ適当に手にとって軽く中身を見てみる。[p]
text.en-US: It certainly looks like many of them are unusual. I pick one and skim through its contents.[p]

text.key: …どうやらこれは花を使ってポプリやお香を作る手芸もののようだった。[lr]
text.en-US: ...Apparently this is a handicraft book about using flowers to make incense and potpourri.[p]

text.key: 家にはないタイプの内容だし、シルヴィなら興味を示すだろうか。[p]
text.en-US: It's the type of content I don't have at home, so I wonder if Sylvie would be interested.[p]

text.key: 興味は惹かれましたか？[lr]
text.en-US: Are you interested? [lr]

text.key: 本来それなりに値は張りますが…、多少はお安くしますよ。[p_]
text.en-US: It's expensive, but for you... I'll keep it at a reasonable price.[p_]

text.key: （シルヴィの件もあるし多めにもらった治療費を返すつもりで購入しようか…。[p_]
text.en-US: (Well, there was the matter with Sylvie, [r]so I'll buy it to repay some of the extra he paid for his treatment fee...[p_]

text.key: それはそれは。お買い上げありがとうございます。[p_]
text.en-US: Well, well. Thank you for your patronage.[p_]

text.key: フェルムさん！！[p]
text.en-US: Mr. Ferrum!![p]

text.key: すいません、お待たせしました！！[p]
text.en-US: I'm really sorry to have kept you waiting!![p]

text.key: お、ちょうど迎えもきたようです。[lr]
text.en-US: Oh, perfect. It seems like the person I'm meeting with just arrived. [lr]

text.key: また機会があればお会いしましょう。[p_]
text.en-US: Let's meet again if we have the opportunity.[p_]

text.key: よし、行くぞ。[p]
text.en-US: Alright, let's go.[p]

text.key: はいっ！！[p]
text.en-US: Yes!![p]

text.key: （男は去っていった。[p_]
text.en-US: (The man left.[p_]

text.key: 荷物も増えたことだし、こちらももうそろそろ帰ろう。[p]
text.en-US: Since I have more luggage now, I head straight home.[p]

text.key: （少し距離があったので足早に近くへ寄る。[p]
text.en-US: (There was a bit of distance between us, so I jogged up next to him.[p]

text.key: ん？[p]
text.en-US: Hm?[p]

text.key: …おや、先生。またお会いしましたね。[lr]
text.en-US: ...Well, hello doctor. So we meet again. [lr]

text.key: わざわざ駈け寄らなくとも声をかけてくれればよかったのに。[p]
text.en-US: Merely calling out to me would have sufficed, there was no need to run my way.[p]

text.key: …あぁ、そういえば結局一度も名乗ってないんでしたね。[lr]
text.en-US: ...Ahh, come to think of it I don't believe I ever gave you my name, did I? [lr]

text.key: 私、名はフェルムと申します。[p]
text.en-US: My name is Ferrum.[p]

text.key: 繰り返し会うこともないと思っていましたし、[r]
text.en-US: There was quite a bit of history between us, not to mention I assumed [r]

text.key: 当初は私に関わってご迷惑をおかけしかねないと思っていたもので。[lr]
text.en-US: involving yourself with me would be a bother. [lr]

text.key: 名も告げぬ失礼を重ねてしまい申し訳ありません。[p]
text.en-US: My sincerest apologies for any inconvenience I may have caused by not giving my name before.[p]

text.key: 今までも何度か不定期にこの街での商売を繰り返していたんですが、[r]
text.en-US: I used to come to this town infrequently, [r]

text.key: 最近大きな商談がまとまりまして。[lr]
text.en-US: but lately a rather lucrative business deal solidified, [lr]

text.key: ここらには定期的に足を運ぶことになりました。[p]
text.en-US: so I'll be a much more common sight around these parts from now on.[p]

text.key: これからも先生が市場に足を運ぶなら顔を合わせる機会もあるでしょう。[p]
text.en-US: If you find yourself wandering into the market, doctor, we will likely cross paths again.[p]

text.key: もちろんまっとうな商売です。[lr]
text.en-US: Of course, all of my business is perfectly legal. [lr]

text.key: ご迷惑をおかけする心配もないでしょう。[p]
text.en-US: I doubt there would be any need to concern yourself with any more... inconveniences.[p]

text.key: さておき先生は買い物ですか。何時ぞやのように何か見てみますか？[p]
text.en-US: Now then, you're shopping, are you not? Might I interest you at a peek at what I have to offer?[p]

text.key: 残念ながら今回は本の手持ちはないので、そうですね…。[lr]
text.en-US: Unfortunately, I don't have any books this time, but let's see... [lr]

text.key: 先生、酒はたしなみますか？[p]
text.en-US: Doctor, do you have a liking for alcohol?[p]

text.key: これは異国にある杏子の亜種のような果物を漬けて作った酒でして、[r]
text.en-US: This is a wine made from the fruit of a subspecies of apricot, [r]

text.key: 現地では梅酒と呼ばれてるものです。[p]
text.en-US: which in its native land is known as 'plum wine'.[p]

text.key: かなり甘いもんだから強い酒が好みなら口に合わないかもしれませんが、[r]
text.en-US: It's considerably sweet, so if stronger spirits are your preference it may not be for you, [r]

text.key: ジュースみたいなもんだと思えば悪くないですし、酒が苦手でも飲みやすいと思いますよ。[p]
text.en-US: but if you think of it as juice it's really not bad, [r]and even if you don't care for alcohol I believe it's quite easy to drink.[p]

text.key: いかがでしょう？[p]
text.en-US: So, how about it?[p]

text.key: [btn/ l='y'  tg='*Ferrum_buy_f'  gr='ch/buy' ][btn/ tg='*Ferrum_not_buy'  gr='ch/not_buy' ]
text.en-US: [btn/ l='y'  tg='*Ferrum_buy_f'  gr='ch/buy_alc' ][btn/ tg='*Ferrum_not_buy'  gr='ch/not_buy' ]

text.key: この時間はここにいることも多いはずです。[lr]
text.en-US: You should be able to find me here at this time of day often. [lr]

text.key: 手元に在庫があればですが、また声をかけてくださればお売りいたしますよ。[p]
text.en-US: It of course depends on if I have more in stock, [r]but assuming I do I would be more than glad to sell you more.[p]

text.key: そうですか、また気が向いたらお声をかけてください。[lr]
text.en-US: I see. If you ever change your mind, do not hesitate to contact me. [lr]

text.key: 手元に在庫があればですが、その時には改めてお売りいたしますよ。[p]
text.en-US: It of course depends on if I have more in stock, [r]but assuming I do I would have no problem selling you a bottle at that time.[p]

text.key: あの奴隷から伝言…ですか？[p]
text.en-US: A message to me from that slave... you say?[p]

text.key: …礼を言われるような筋合いはありませんよ。[p]
text.en-US: I have done no such praiseworthy noble deed.[p]

text.key: 私からしたら面倒ごとを他人に押し付けただけです。[lr]
text.en-US: If there's anything I've done, it's foist my problems onto others. [lr]

text.key: 先生だってわかってるでしょう。言ってやらなかったんですか？[p]
text.en-US: Surely you understand, doctor. Did I not say the same when we met again that day?[p]

text.key: （買ってきた酒をシルヴィと試してみよう。[p_]
text.en-US: (Let's try out that wine with Sylvie.[p_]

text.key: お酒…？[lr_]
text.en-US: Alcohol...? [lr_]

text.key: 一緒にいただいていいんですか？[p_]
text.en-US: Is it all right for me to have some with you?[p_]

text.key: （控えめにグラスに注ぎ、少し水で割ってシルヴィに渡す。[p_]
text.en-US: (For moderation's sake I poured a little into a glass and diluted [r]it with water before handing it to Sylvie.[p_]

text.key: ん、なんだか甘い匂い。[lr_]
text.en-US: Hm, it smells somewhat sweet. [lr_]

text.key: いい香りですね。[p_]
text.en-US: It's a nice fragrance.[p_]

text.key: …果物を浸けた甘くて珍しいお酒？[lr_]
text.en-US: ...A strange, fruity alcohol? [lr_]

text.key: そんなものもあるんですか。[p_]
text.en-US: So something like this exists...[p_]

text.key: えっと…乾杯です。[p_]
text.en-US: Um... cheers![p_]

text.key: なんだか甘くてジュースみたいですけど、お酒っぽい香りもしますね。[lr_]
text.en-US: It's kind of sweet like juice, but at the same time it has an alcoholic scent. [lr_]

text.key: 飲みやすくて美味しいです。[p_]
text.en-US: It's tasty and easy to drink.[p_]

text.key: （シルヴィと少しお酒を楽しもう。[p_]
text.en-US: (Let's enjoy this alcohol with Sylvie for a bit.[p_]

text.key: 一緒にいただいていいんですか？[lr_]
text.en-US: Is it all right to join you? [lr_]

text.key: はい、いただきます。[p_]
text.en-US: Yes, I'll have some.[p_]

text.key: じゃあ、乾杯です。[p_]
text.en-US: Well, cheers![p_]

text.key: んく…。[lr_]
text.en-US: _*gulp*... [lr_]

text.key: （もう夜も遅くなってきた。[p_]
text.en-US: (The night is growing old.[p_]

text.key: [xy x='895'  y='164'  y_add='73'  preg1='menu/s_menu/wine_' ]

（もうボトルは空だ。[p_]
text.en-US: The bottle's totally empty.[p_]

text.key: （これ以上は飲ませないほうがいいだろう。[p_]
text.en-US: (I don't think I should let her have any more.[p_]

text.key: おかわりいただいていいんですか？[lr_]
text.en-US: Is it all right to get another glass? [lr_]

text.key: ありがとうございます。じゃあいただきます。[p_]
text.en-US: Thank you very much. I'll have some.[p_]

text.key: （シルヴィのグラスに酒を注ぎ足した。[p_]
text.en-US: (I filled Sylvie's glass with wine.[p_]

text.key: お酒にもいろいろ種類があるんですよね。[lr_]
text.en-US: There sure are lots of kinds of alcohol. [lr_]

text.key: こういう甘いのだったらジュースみたいで飲みやすいです。[p_]
text.en-US: Sweet things like this are like juice and are very easy to drink.[p_]

text.key: 昔に赤ワインをひと口だけ、飲んだことがあるんですけど[r]
text.en-US: I have had a sip of red wine in the past, but [r]

text.key: 渋くてあんまり美味しくは感じませんでしたね。[p_]
text.en-US: it was bitter and didn't taste very good.[p_]

text.key: でも、どこかいい香りもしたので、[r]
text.en-US: But it had a nice scent to it, [r]

text.key: いつか舌がもっと大人になったらワインも楽しめるようになるのかなって思います。[p_]
text.en-US: so I thought that maybe my tongue would grow up someday so I could enjoy wine.[p_]

text.key: お酒を飲むとなんだか大人になった気分になります。[p_]
text.en-US: Drinking alcohol like this makes me feel like I've become an adult.[p_]

text.key: ちょっと体がポカポカしてきたかもしれません。[p_]
text.en-US: My body's kinda warm I think.[p_]

text.key: 冷たい飲み物なのに、喉を通るとあったかい。[lr_]
text.en-US: It's a cold drink, but when it goes down my throat it becomes warm... [lr_]

text.key: 不思議ですね。[p_]
text.en-US: How strange.[p_]

text.key: [name]はどんなお酒が好きなんでしょうか。[lr_]
text.en-US: I wonder, what sort of alcohol do you like, [name]? [lr_]

text.key: [name]のお気に入りとかがあったら、私もいつか試してみたいな…なんて。[p_]
text.en-US: If there's something you like, I'd like to share it with you someday...or something.[p_]
...Hehe♡[p_]

text.key: 誰かと一緒にお酒を楽しむって、大人の贅沢って感じですね。[p_]
text.en-US: Being able to share alcohol with someone is the luxury of adults, huh?[p_]

text.key: 美味しいですね♡[p_]
text.en-US: This sure is tasty♡[p_]

text.key: お酒って飲みながらつまむ食べ物がありますよね、[lr_]
text.en-US: Alcohol usually has little bite-sized snacks that go along with it, [lr_]

text.key: チーズとかオリーブとか。[p_]
text.en-US: like cheese or olives, right?[p_]

text.key: お酒によって合うものも違うらしいですけど、[r]
text.en-US: What snack goes with what alcohol is different, but [r]

text.key: こういうお酒にはどんなものが合うんでしょうね。[p_]
text.en-US: I wonder what sort would go best with this one?[p_]

text.key: お酒のおつまみって色々食べたことがあるわけじゃないけど、[lr_]
text.en-US: I haven't really eaten many hors d'oeuvres, [lr_]

text.key: お茶菓子と違ってそれだけで美味しいものは少ない気がしますね。[p_]
text.en-US: but unlike tea snacks, I get the feeling they wouldn't be as good on their own.[p_]

text.key: 私の好みの問題なんでしょうか？[p_]
text.en-US: Is it more a problem with my tastes I wonder?[p_]

text.key: ほんの少し…眠くなってきたような気がします。[lr_]
text.en-US: I feel like... I've gotten a little bit sleepy. [lr_]

text.key: …お酒でぼんやりしてるんでしょうか？[p_]
text.en-US: ...I wonder if it's the alcohol making me a little woozy?[p_]

text.key: 美味しいお酒、ありがとうございます。[name]。[p_]
text.en-US: Thank you for the delicious wine, [name].[p_]

text.key: ボトルの方の匂いを嗅いだら少しくらっとしました。[lr_]
text.en-US: Smelling directly from the bottle makes me feel a little dizzy. [lr_]

text.key: 水で薄めてもそんなに味薄く感じませんし、濃いお酒なんですね。[p_]
text.en-US: Even diluted with water the taste doesn't seem weaker, so it must be a strong wine.[p_]

text.key: 嫌なことがあるとお酒に溺れてしまう人もいるらしいですね。[lr_]
text.en-US: There are people who drown their worries in alcohol, aren't there? [lr_]

text.key: 私はその心配はないと思いますけど。[p_]
text.en-US: I'm not worried about that though.[p_]

text.key: こんな甘いお酒があるなんて知りませんでした。[lr_]
text.en-US: I had no idea such sweet alcohol existed. [lr_]

text.key: きっと他にも私の知らないお酒がたくさんあるんでしょうね。[p_]
text.en-US: There must be lots of different types of alcohol I have no knowledge of.[p_]

text.key: お酒ってものによってアルコールの強さが違うらしいですけど、[r]
text.en-US: It seems that the amount of alcohol is different between different drinks, [r]

text.key: これはどれぐらいなんでしょうね？[lr_]
text.en-US: but how much alcohol is in this one, I wonder? [lr_]

text.key: 私が飲めるぐらいだからそんなに強くはないんでしょうけど。[p_]
text.en-US: I can drink it, so it can't be that strong, right?[p_]

text.key: お酒と言ったらガラスの瓶ですね。[lr_]
text.en-US: When it comes to wine they come in bottles don't they? [lr_]

text.key: ものによって形や大きさが違って綺麗ですよね。[p_]
text.en-US: Different drinks come in different shapes and sizes, but they're all so pretty.[p_]

text.key: 空になっても捨てるのがもったいないです。[p_]
text.en-US: Even if it becomes empty, it seems like a waste to just throw it away...[p_]

text.key: そういえば
text.en-US: &'Thinking about it, '

text.key: 飲む量が多くないからだと思いますけど、[r]
text.en-US: it could be because I haven't had very much of it, [r]

text.key: 今の所お酒を飲んだ翌日に頭が痛くなったりしたことはないですね。[p_]
text.en-US: but I haven't ever woken up the next day with a headache from drinking alcohol before.[p_]

text.key: たくさん飲む人は二日酔いっていうのになるらしいですね。[p_]
text.en-US: I've heard that people who drink a lot can be drunk for two whole days.[p_]

text.key: 最初はちょっとお酒っぽさがあってジュースとは違う違和感がありましけど、[lr_]
text.en-US: At first there was a definite sense that this was alcohol and not juice, so I was worried, [lr_]

text.key: なんだかもう慣れてきました。[p_]
text.en-US: but I feel like I've gotten used to the taste now.[p_]

text.key: …なんでもないです♡[p_]
text.en-US: ...It's nothing♡[p_]

text.key: お酒美味しいですね…[name]♡[p_]
text.en-US: The wine is tasty, isn't it...[name]?♡[p_]

text.key: [name]〜♡[lr_]
text.en-US: [name]〜♡ [lr_]

text.key: 大好きですよ、[name]♡[lr_]
text.en-US: I loves you, [name]♡ [lr_]

text.key: 大好きだから大好きって言っちゃいけませんか？[p_]
text.en-US: I loves you, so can't I tell you how much?[p_]

text.key: もっとくっついてもいいですか？[lr_]
text.en-US: Can I get closer to you? [lr_]

text.key: くっついちゃいますね♡[p_]
text.en-US: I'll scoot closer then♡[p_]

text.key: （犬猫のように体を擦りつけてくる…。[p_]
text.en-US: (She leaned right up against me as if she were a dog or a cat...[p_]

text.key: 幸せ…私は幸せですよ♡[lr_]
text.en-US: Sho happy... I'm sho happy!♡ [lr_]

text.key: だって[name]がいるんですもん♡[p_]
text.en-US: I mean... [name] is here after all♡[p_]

text.key: ひっく…。[lr_]
ふふ、すいません♡[p_]
text.en-US: Hehe, I'm shorry♡[p_]

text.key: [name]？何かしてほしいことありませんか？[p_]
text.en-US: [name]? Is there anything you wanna do?[p_]

text.key: 私なんだってしますよ？[lr_]
text.en-US: I'll do annnything! [lr_]

text.key: [name]のお願いなんでも聞いちゃいますよ♡[p_]
text.en-US: I'll listen to your evry desire, [name]♡[p_]

text.key: ちょっと暑いですねぇ…、[lr_]
text.en-US: It's kinda hot in here... [lr_]

text.key: 暑くないですか？[p_]
text.en-US: Aren't you hot?[p_]

text.key: [name]ももっと飲んだらどうですか？[lr_]
text.en-US: Would you like some more, [name]? [lr_]

text.key: あ、私が注ぎましょうか♡[p_]
text.en-US: Ah, let me pour it for you♡[p_]

text.key: [name]…頭撫でてください♡[lr_]
text.en-US: [name]... Please pat my head♡ [lr_]

text.key: あ、先にギュってして…それから撫でてください♡[p_]
text.en-US: Ah, but hug me first...then pat my head please♡[p_]

text.key: 私将来はお医者さんになってたくさん[name]のお手伝いしますよ。[p_]
text.en-US: I wanna become a doctor in the future, so I can help [name] as much as I can![p_]

text.key: …あれ、違う。[lr_]
text.en-US: ...Uh, wait no. [lr_]

text.key: 看護師さんになってたくさん[name]のお手伝いしますよ♡[p_]
text.en-US: I wanna become a nurse and help [name] to the fullest!♡[p_]

text.key: （シルヴィは正面からこちらに抱きついてきた。[p_]
text.en-US: (Sylvie hugged me from the front.[p_]

text.key: [name]〜♡[p_]
text.en-US: [name]〜♡[p_]

text.key: （幸せそうにじゃれついている。[p_]
text.en-US: (She's happily fawning over me.[p_]

text.key: （がっちりと脚で胴を抱きしめ、こちらの胸に頬をすり寄せている。[p_]
text.en-US: (With her legs firmly wrapped around my torso she's stroking her cheek against my chest.[p_]

text.key: [name]も…もっとギュってしてください。[p_]
text.en-US: [name]... Hug me mooore please![p_]

text.key: どこにもいっちゃやぁですよ？[lr_]
text.en-US: An don't go nowhere, kay? [lr_]

text.key: 絶対離れませんからね…♡[p_]
text.en-US: I'll never let you go...♡[p_]

text.key: なんだか眠くなってきちゃいましたぁ…♡[p_]
text.en-US: I'm gettin kinda sleepy...♡[p_]

text.key: 体も心もあったかいです…♡[p_]
text.en-US: My body and heart are both waaarm...♡[p_]

text.key: なんだかポワポワします…。[lr_]
text.en-US: I feel kinda fuzzy... [lr_]

text.key: ポワポワ…。[p_]
text.en-US: Fuzzhy...[p_]

text.key: （こちらの胸元に顔を埋めている。[p_]
text.en-US: (Sylvie buried her face in my chest.[p_]

text.key: スゥ…。[l]
text.en-US: _*sniff* [l]

text.key: えへへ、[name]の匂い♡[p_]
text.en-US: Ehehe, it's [name]'s smell♡[p_]

text.key: ギュってしてください♡ギュって♡[p_]
text.en-US: Hug me pleashe♡ Huug♡[p_]

text.key: 体がポカポカしてきました。[lr_]
text.en-US: My body's all warm. [lr_]

text.key: [name]もポカポカしましょう？[lr_]
text.en-US: Let's make [name] all warm too! [lr_]

text.key: えいっ♡[p_]
text.en-US: Whee!♡[p_]

text.key: （こちらを抱きしめてくるシルヴィから温かな体温が伝わってくる。[p_]
text.en-US: (The warmth from Sylvie radiates into my body as she suddenly clings to me.[p_]

text.key: [name]、キスしてください。[p_]
text.en-US: [name], please kiss me.[p_]

text.key: （目を閉じてこちらの反応を待っている。[p_]
text.en-US: (She closes her eyes and waits for my reaction.[p_]

text.key: [name]、服屋さんに行った時服屋さんのこと見ますよね…。[lr_]
text.en-US: [name], when we go to the clothes shop you're alwaysh lookin at the shop lady... [lr_]

text.key: 店員だから当たり前とかそういうんじゃなくて…。[p_]
text.en-US: Not cuz she's da employee or anythin...[p_]

text.key: いいんですか？ああいうのが。[p_]
text.en-US: Should I shay...thingsh like dat...?[p_]

text.key: 私も将来あれぐらいになってみせますよ。[lr_]
